uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.data.filter

Class JoinerFilter<T extends DataObject,BDO extends DataObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.data.filter.JoinerFilter<T,BDO>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - remote table type
    BDO - target table type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contexed, BaseFilter<BDO>, BaseSQLFilter<BDO>, JoinFilter<BDO>, MultiTableFilter, SQLFilter<BDO>, LinkClause, Targetted<BDO>

    public final class JoinerFilter<T extends DataObject,BDO extends DataObject>
extends java.lang.Object
implements SQLFilter<BDO>, JoinFilter<BDO>, LinkClause, Contexed
    Filter to join two tables. This performs a left join so records without references are available for selection but the filter visitor in BaseCombineFilter also adds the joining clause to the WHERE condition which would normally suppress these. This is to allow OR combinations of filters to work. The records without references are available to OR branches that do not contain this filter. We still have a problem with reversed references (remote table points to source) if different remote peers match different branches of an OR then the target will be matched multiple times so we should consider using a BackJoinFilter instead for these if we don't actually need the joined fields in the result. This filter cannot be used if multiple joins to the same table are required because table aliases are not supported.

      • addJoin

        public void addJoin(java.util.Set<Repository> tables,
                    java.lang.StringBuilder join_clause,
                    java.util.Set<LinkClause> additions)
        Description copied from interface: JoinFilter
        add join clause to add to query. Each Repository should only be joined to once. A table may be joined to multiple times if via a Repository with an alias. If the Repository being joined to is already present the join_clause is left unchanged but the LinkClause is added to the additions list.
        Specified by:
        addJoin in interface JoinFilter<BDO extends DataObject>
        Parameters:
        tables - Set of Repositorys in join (updated)
        join_clause - Query join clause (modified)
        additions - Additional LinkClauses to add to select
